newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-CELTIC LEAVE IT LATE AGAINST RAITH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CELTIC LEAVE IT LATE AGAINST RAITH.

text.p: Two goals in the final 17 minutes against bottom club Raith on Tuesday kept alive injury-hit Celtic's slim Scottish premier division title hopes.

They won 2-1 to cut the gap between themselves and runaway leaders Rangers to eight points. Jorge Cadete's 21st goal of the season, a header, revitalised lacklustre Celtic after Dane Soeren Andersen had marked his home debut for Raith with a goal in the 14th minute.
Late pressure paid off for Celtic with Chris Hay, a 58th minute substitute, netting with barely a minute to play.
